@kkonstantine Updated, good catch. I've now grepped through the code to make sure we're not using `getCanonicalName` elsewhere since it isn't what we want but *sounds* like it -- the only remaining use is harmless.

@hachikuji If you happen to have time to review, we can probably squeeze this into 0.11.0.0 -- there's some sort of small feature provision to get things in post-feature-freeze. If not, we can always bump it to a future release, in which case I'll create yet another KIP-66 JIRA and relabel this.

@mjsax @ewencp @dguy @guozhangwang  ,can you take a look at this PR? It relates to issue：KAFKA-4603 ,It's too long to almost forget 
The issue is still “IN PROGRESS”
I just want to finish it properly
thx

@junrao, can you please review this?

@mihbor a key thing that seems to be missing seems to be that if no events arrive, the system timer will never trigger. So we have again the issue that in absence of events, `punctuate` is never called. I could be missing something. Is the way around this to call `maybePunctuate` in the `runLoop` method in `StreamThread.java` right before calling `maybeCommit`? That way we can check the time after each poll. cc @mjsax @guozhangwang on this as well. This, and associated tests around system time, seem to be key things missing IMO. Thanks.
FYI - the test failures are unrelated

* `MemoryByteBuffer` is limited to 2GB file size.
* `MmapBufferPool` is now familiar to trunk's `BufferPool`. It is probably better to have `MmapBufferPool` sublcass `BufferPool` instead of creating a common interface. I won't be doing this yet.

`MmapBufferPool` can't pass `BufferPool`'s `testStressfulSituation`. I'm not sure if this kills `MmapBufferPool` as a buffer implementation or if it just needs different stressful situation.

@auroraxlh From the JIRA ticket it seems you are trying to solve relatively separate two issues:

1) `zookeeper.connection` actually passing its value to `zookeeper.connection.timeout`, which is incorrect.

2) abbreviations are allowed in all the command tools because of `new OptionParser()`.

You has fixed 1) in https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2322, while for 2) I'm not sure how much of a risk to allow abbreviations, and since it may change the behavior of all command tools (say if someone is using it with abbreviations in his operational tool-suite this change will suddenly break their code), could you elaborate a bit on the actual risk and better motivate this change?

I added a check for inter broker protocol version in all the transactional APIs as it seems to make sense to bail out early if the version is not at least what is expected.
Additionally in `handleAddPartitionToTxnRequest` check if all the topics in the request are using the correct message format. error out if any aren't.

Still need to add tests, but this is more to make sure i'm thinking about this correctly.

@guozhangwang @hachikuji @apurvam @ijuma
Review by @junrao.

@umesh9794 Thanks for the patch. Can you assign the JIRA to yourself?

Build fails due to checkstyle errors. Btw: we plan to remove `KafkaStreams#toString()` (cf. https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/KAFKA/KIP+130%3A+Expose+states+of+active+tasks+to+KafkaStreams+public+API) -- so I am actually not sure, how extensive this test should be. Right now it pretty basic, but might be good enough. \cc @dguy @enothereska @guozhangwang @bbejeck

> We probably also need a test that ensures that data in the state stores adheres to exactly once, i.e., when there is a hard crash and recovers. Probably a system test.

see disabled test `shouldNotViolateEosIfOneTaskFailsWithState` :)

And yes, this is just a first PR adding test -- we will need more, including system tests.

@hachikuji @junrao I addressed your comments with a single function, one small drawback is that if there is already an existing txn metadata upon `initPid` it will waste a pid. But in practice producer fencing should be rare so hopefully it does not have huge impact.

I think it may make sense to actually fix this behavior: for instance, we should move the high water mark forward only if the size(ISR) >= min.isr. Otherwise, the high watermark stays the same even if you have producers producing with acks = 1.
